unnormalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Traction Across India**
normalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Traction Across India**

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26th – Reliance Jio and Airtel are aggressively expanding their Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) networks across India, driving competition and improved connectivity for consumers. Both telecom giants are focusing on Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities, aiming to bridge the digital divide.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty sixth – Reliance Jio and Airtel are aggressively expanding their Fiber-to-Home (F T T H) networks across India, driving competition and improved connectivity for consumers. Both telecom giants are focusing on Tier two and Tier three cities, aiming to bridge the digital divide.

unnormalised: Dr. Sunil Sharma, a telecom analyst at IIT Kanpur, notes, "FTTH is crucial for supporting India's growing data consumption, driven by streaming services and online education." Airtel recently announced plans to connect 5 million homes with fiber in the next fiscal year, investing Rs. 10,000 crore.
normalised: Doctor Sunil Sharma, a telecom analyst at I I T Kanpur, notes, "F T T H is crucial for supporting India's growing data consumption, driven by streaming services and online education." Airtel recently announced plans to connect five million homes with fiber in the next fiscal year, investing rupees ten thousand crore.

unnormalised: Jio, not to be left behind, is reportedly offering discounted plans to attract new subscribers, including bundled OTT subscriptions. The expansion efforts also involve laying thousands of km of optical fiber cable, creating numerous job opportunities.
normalised: Jio, not to be left behind, is reportedly offering discounted plans to attract new subscribers, including bundled O T T subscriptions. The expansion efforts also involve laying thousands of kilometer of optical fiber cable, creating numerous job opportunities.

unnormalised: This infrastructure push will enable faster internet speeds, essential for modern applications like smart homes and online gaming. A typical FTTH connection can easily support data rates exceeding 100 Mbps, unlocking significant potential for homes and businesses in areas ranging from 500 sq ft apartments to larger villas. The increased connectivity promises a digital Diwali for many.
normalised: This infrastructure push will enable faster internet speeds, essential for modern applications like smart homes and online gaming. A typical F T T H connection can easily support data rates exceeding one hundred M B P S, unlocking significant potential for homes and businesses in areas ranging from five hundred square feet apartments to larger villas. The increased connectivity promises a digital Diwali for many.
